sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Limited Worker Cooperative Association Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Limited Worker Cooperative Association Act.

sections.heading: Findings.
sections.text: The General Assembly finds and declares all of the following:

sections.heading: Powers of Secretary of State and rulemaking.
sections.text: Powers of Secretary of State and rulemaking.

sections.heading: Purpose of limited worker cooperative association.
sections.text: Purpose of limited worker cooperative association.

sections.heading: Application of the Limited Liability Company Act
sections.text: The Limited Liability Company Act applies to limited worker cooperative associations, and they shall enjoy the powers and privileges and be subject to the duties, restrictions, and liabilities of limited liability companies, except where inconsistent

sections.heading: Formation of limited worker cooperative association.
sections.text: Formation of limited worker cooperative association.

sections.text: Articles of organization. The articles of organization of a limited worker cooperative association shall state:

sections.heading: Organization of limited worker cooperative association.
sections.text: Organization of limited worker cooperative association.

sections.heading: Board of managers or managing members.
sections.text: Board of managers or managing members.

sections.heading: Dissolution and termination. A limited worker cooperative association may be dissolved by (1) a two-thirds vote of the assembly, (2) a majority vote of the assembly as stated in the cooperative agreement, or (3) administratively
sections.text: The vote shall be in accordance with Section 55, and upon dissolution

sections.heading: Grounds for administrative dissolution. The Secretary of State may dissolve any limited worker cooperative association administratively if:
sections.text: Grounds for administrative dissolution. The Secretary of State may dissolve any limited worker cooperative association administratively if:

sections.heading: Conversion.  A limited worker cooperative association may convert into any form of entity permitted if the board of managers or managing members of the limited worker cooperative association adopts a plan of conversion and the assembly adopts such a plan by a two-thirds majority vote
sections.text:
In the case o
cooperative, a limited worker cooperative association may
convert into any form of entity permitted if the members
adopt a plan by a two-thirds majority vote. Conversions from
other forms of entities to a limited worker cooperative
association are governed by the Entity Omnibus Act.

sections.heading: Exemption from securities laws
sections.text: Any interest, patronage refund, per unit retain certificate, or evidence of membership issued or sold by a limited worker cooperative association is exempt from the registration requirements of the Illinois Securities Law of 1953. Such interests, patronage refunds,

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2020.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2020.
